name: Facial Spray with Aloe, Herbs and Rosewater
about: What it is: A multipurpose hydrating rose face mist to rejuvenate dehydrated skin with a dewy glow anytime, anywhere...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Dryness..Formulation: Liquid..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Rose: Rejuvenating..- Gardenia Extract: Antioxidants..- Thyme Extract: Clarifying...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: This floral face mist features complexion-loving rose and gardenia extracts, skin-softening bladderwrack (a type of mineral-rich seaweed) extract, clarifying thyme extract to boost the complexion, and aloe vera to soothe and hydrate. Mist whenever, wherever for radiant and reenergized skin.
ingredients: -Rose: Rejuvenating..-Gardenia Extract: Antioxidants..-Thyme Extract: Clarifying. ..Aqua (Water, Eau), Propylene Glycol, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Rosa Canina Extract, Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Leaf Extract, Fucus Vesiculosus Extract, Gardenia Florida Fruit Extract, Caprylyl Glycol, Hexylene Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Parfum (Fragrance), Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Chloride, Citronellol, Geraniol, Ci 17200 (Red 33), Ci 42090 (Blue 1).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Mist onto face, neck, or hair as needed..-Use it to infuse more hydration before or after applying moisturizer, as a pick-me-up on the go, or post-makeup application to give skin a dewy finish..-To give your makeup a dewy finish, spritz your favorite brush or sponge before blending in foundation or concealer. Once you're done, mist your face as a final step to add radiance. .-For an extra refreshing and cooling boost, store the bottle in your refrigerator..-If product gets into eyes, rinse well with water.

reviews.review_title: A must-have in my make-up routine!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The Facial Spray with Aloe, Herbs, and Rosewater is a must-have for anyone looking for a refreshing and hydrating mist. This spray is perfect for use before applying makeup, as it helps to prep and prime the skin, and after makeup application to set and refresh the look. The combination of aloe, herbs, and rosewater provides a soothing and calming effect on the skin, leaving it feeling hydrated and rejuvenated. I especially love using this spray on my beauty blender when applying or blending foundation, as it helps to create a smooth and flawless finish. Overall, this product is a holy grail for me and I can't live without it!

reviews.review_text: I got the mini to try MB for the first time..I wasn't expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised. It does hydrate your skin for a temporary period, maybe lasts about an hour. My skin didn't feel dry and felt hydrated. It's particularly good if you are having a long day outside and don't have time to apply other products. The price point is good too!  However, it has a very strong Rose scent, when you spray it on your face! So I won't be repurchasing this one, but will definitely try the other scented mists. If you don't like strong scents, don't get this.

Yes, thereu2019s perfume but it doesnu2019t affect my eczema at all. Otherwise, works great on sunburns.

It did nothing for me and the spray mist is not fine enough, it's inconsistent and would leave me with random huge drops. I would buy Caudalie grape water over this anytime of the day.

reviews.review_title: Use it CORRECTLY and it works!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: For people saying it's just scented water (that's the point) and it doesn't do anything, you're not using it correctly.  Facial mists are meant to be used in conjunction with your other facial products because some products are best applied to damp skin. A facial mist dampens skin after cleansing so that your other products can go on smoothly and have some water to work with.  Don't use this by itself- use it under your serum so that there's a layer of moisture in between your just cleansed face and your product, so that any hyaluronic acid in your skincare isn't pulling water FROM your face! Hyaluronic acid will take whatever moisture is the most convenient- and if you're putting it directly onto a dry face, that's going to be your skin!  For what it's meant to do, it works great. I've noticed that my skin is a lot less dry and flaky since adding this to my skincare routine.  The best way to use this is to cleanse, pat your face dry, spray a light layer, then immediately add your serum or moisturizer over top before it dries completely. You want that dampness!  I like that this facial mist is basically just water and humectants- it's designed to really add moisture when used properly.  Again, do NOT just spray it over your face without doing anything else. If absolutely WILL dry your skin out if you use it by itself.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like spraying this product after i finish my skin care routine; i find it really relaxing and refreshing. The perfume is not strong in it but it's there. I took it with me to the beach and it was so so so nice to have with me because it gets hella hot. There are better facial sprays than this one for more seamless makeup but this one isnt bad

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have all 3 and didnu2019t look after my skin previously (Iu2019m crazy about what I use now due to adult acne). But it has wayyyy too many fragrances in the ingredients. Definitely a no from me. Didnu2019t do much for my skin when I did use it anyways. Good prize, bad product.

reviews.review_text: Great value, big bottle and a little goes a long way. Works really well for my skin and I also use it to wet my beauty blender and brushes. Would recommend makes you feel really fresh. Pleasant scent, just donu2019t get the purple one

It's formulated with rose extract, gardenia extra, and thyme extract. u2060I'm probably going to upset some folks with this one but I don't like it. The spray is heavily scented, it's not an even spray, it's made with colour dyes (why?), and it actually dries me out in the chin area. u2060Hard pass for me.

I wanted a quick mist that I could spray on my face throughout the day for a little boost of hydration, but this does not do that. If anything, this spray felt sticky and didnu2019t feel refreshing at all. I have started using this spray on my body, and it is ok for that, but I would still not recommend nor would I repurchase.

reviews.review_text: Please stop using it, yu2019all. I know the packaging is cute and aesthetically pleasing (and itu2019s nice when youu2019re on a budget no doubt) but itu2019s just not worth the damage youu2019ll do to your skin. This is essentially just heavily fragranced rubbing alcohol tinted pink in a cute little bottleu2014 do yourself a favour and buy a safer alternative online, or try the Laneige spray.

reviews.review_text: i love !!! such an amazing product if you have oily skin this spray feels amazing so refreshing, clean, and it doesnu2019t feel like those products that leave a residue once it dries, once it dries it feels like nothing on your skin and it leaves your skin feeling soft, and glowing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the first product I have tried from the Mario Badescu line and based on this experience I don't know that I will try any other products.  The spray comes out splotchy, the mist is not fine enough to spray onto the skin evenly.  It smells very strongly of rose. I wanted to use it as a refreshing spray throughout the day (my face ends up feeling so yucky under a mask all day) but found that it left my skin feeling like it was coated in a sticky layer that never fully absorbed. It didn't cause any adverse reactions on my skin or anything, but I didn't like the way it felt.  I wouldn't recommend this product and I certainly won't repurchase it.

reviews.review_text: It is good, a little bit sticky after applying but that is fine since I use it as toner in the first stage in my skincare routine. However, I think I won't buy it again because its result is just normal. It is good for sensitive skin anway.

I dont think I think it for setting makeup as it leaves my already oily skin looking rather wet! perhaps would be better for a more dry skin type in that regard. I love it on skin! very soothing and is helping my redness thus far, my boyfriend even loves it!
